title: How to Make Faygo Cupcakes

steps.headline: Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees Farenheit (175 degrees Celsius).
Mix butter, sugar, and eggs in large bowl.
Add vanilla, baking soda, salt, and baking powder to mixture.
One cup at a time, slowly mix in flour.
If you are making more than one flavour of cupcake, separate the batter into the appropriate number of containers, depending on how many flavours you're making.
steps.description: If you are making only one flavour, skip this step.

steps.headline: Add food colouring (optional).
steps.description: It might be best to use a colour close to the hue of the flavour of Faygo you're using. If you don't want to add food colouring, skip this step.

steps.headline: Add Faygo.
steps.description: Stir until liquid is completely absorbed.

steps.headline: Fill cupcake holders 3/4 way with batter.
Take cupcakes out of oven with mitts.
steps.description: Be sure to take caution. If you do not want to add frosting, you're done! If you want frosting, continue on to next step.

steps.headline: Mix corresponding food dye with white frosting.
steps.description: (For example, for a blue cupcake, make blue frosting.)

steps.headline: Apply frosting to tops of cupcakes with icing knife.

text: Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees Farenheit (175 degrees Celsius).  Mix butter, sugar, and eggs in large bowl.  Add vanilla, baking soda, salt, and baking powder to mixture. Stir well. One cup at a time, slowly mix in flour. Stir thoroughly after each cup. If you are making more than one flavour of cupcake, separate the batter into the appropriate number of containers, depending on how many flavours you're making. If you are making only one flavour, skip this step. Add food colouring (optional). It might be best to use a colour close to the hue of the flavour of Faygo you're using. If you don't want to add food colouring, skip this step. Add Faygo. Stir until liquid is completely absorbed. Fill cupcake holders 3/4 way with batter.  Cook in oven for 22-25 minutes.  Take cupcakes out of oven with mitts. Be sure to take caution. If you do not want to add frosting, you're done! If you want frosting, continue on to next step. Mix corresponding food dye with white frosting. (For example, for a blue cupcake, make blue frosting.) Apply frosting to tops of cupcakes with icing knife.  Enjoy!
